DOC.brief_summary: - Main objective compare ability Latanoprost 0.005 % preservative-added ophthalmic solution versus Tafluprost 0.0015 % preservative-free ophthalmic solution , give day even , reduce 24-hour intraocular pressure ( IOP ) patient primary open angle glaucoma ( POAG ) and/or ocular hypertension ( OHT ) first diagnosis . First efficacy variable difference mean nocturnal IOP value three month treatment : nocturnal IOP define mean value 2AM 6AM measurement . - Secondary objective comparison Latanoprost 0.005 % Tafluprost 0.0015 % ophthalmic solution : - Mean 24-hour IOP value three month treatment - IOP value time-points : 10AM ( ± 1 hour ) , 2PM ( ± 1 hour ) , 6PM ( ± 1 hour ) , 10PM ( ± 1 hour ) , 2AM ( ± 1 hour ) 6AM ( ± 1 hour ) three month treatment
DOC.brief_title: Latanoprost Versus Tafluprost : 24-hour Intraocular Pressure ( IOP )
DOC.criteria: Male female patient > 45 year Damage optic nerve alteration visual field case POAG , defect optic nerve visual field case OHT Untreated IOP > 24 mm Hg < 32 mm Hg least one eye baseline ( 10AM ) central corneal thickness 500 600 μm Negative pregnancy test ( fertile woman ) . Fertile woman attend study must express clear avoid pregnancy study period next three month Informed consent start study Secondary glaucoma ( SturgeWeber syndrome , Neurofibromatosis I , neovascular glaucoma , steroid glaucoma , etc ) Anterior segment anomaly ( cataract , iridocorneal disgenesy , congenital ectropion uvae , etc ) Past ocular surgery , except cataract surgery previous 6 month Corneal abnormality influence IOP measurement ( corneal oedema ) Positive pregnancy test breastfeed woman . No avoid pregnancy study period next three month
